intro: Fagara culantrilo var. continentalis, commonly known as the continental fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically opposite and have a serrated margin. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by dark blue berries. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
